content: alice s amazing no gusset fingerless mitts by alice bish ribbing is amazing it stretches and contracts as you need this pattern is easy to memorize and requires no gusset easily done on a magic loop with a long circular or on double points feel free to pick the method of knitting in the round that suits you sized for adult will accommodate a hand circumference of anywhere from 6 to 9 materials 100 yards of worsted weight yarn yarn used in photo noro vintage 64% wool 24% silk 12% angora 110 yards per 50 gram skein color #2 1 skein optional marker to mark beginning of round needles us #6 40 long circular or set of double pointed needles every knitter is different please adjust needle size to give you the best fabric for the project gauge 4sts per inch in ribbing slightly stretched abbreviations used k = knit p = purl k2tbl = knit 2 together through the back loops kfb = knit in the front and back instructions same for both left and right hands cast on 39 stitches join to knit in the round work a k2 p1 ribbing for 5 5 inches thumb cast off at the start of the next round knit 2 *slip left needle into the front of two stitches on the right hand needle k2tbl knit 1 repeat from * until you have a total of 11 stitches bound off continue in k2 p1 to the gap created by the bind off using the left hand needle and going from front to back lift the strand between the last stitch worked and the first stitch that was bound off knit this through the back this maneuver is called m1l on knittinghelp com 29 sts connect to work in the round and kfb in the first stitch after the bound off gap continue knitting k2 p1 ribbing in the round for another inch and an half 30 sts bind off all stitches in the same manner as you bound off for the thumb cast off make a second
